thread.title: Chat rewind: Former Seahawks running back Curt Warner
thread.title_full: Chat rewind: Former Seahawks running back Curt Warner | The Seattle Times

author: Sean Quinton
title: Chat rewind: Former Seahawks running back Curt Warner
text:
Welcome to our live chat with former Seahawks running back Curt Warner, who is in Seattle to get you ready for the upcoming Seahawks’ season and talk about new enhancements to the X1 Sports app from Comcast . The Q&A runs from 1:30 to 2:30 p.m. Pacific time, but we are accepting questions for submission starting now. Simply type a screen name into the window above, type out your question and hit “submit” — your question will go into moderation and we will get to it as soon as we can.
November 10, 1986 photo: Seahawk running back Curt Warner found no running room on this third quarter play and was held to only 16 yards total rushing. (Andy Nelson/Seattle Times File) Before Marshawn Lynch and Shaun Alexander ruled the Seattle running game, there was Curt Warner — a menacing running back, who tore up the Kingdome turf on his way to three Pro Bowls and a then record-setting career with the Seahawks.
Warner played in Seattle for seven seasons, eclipsing 1,000 yards rushing four times and totaling 6,844 yards rushing and 56 total touchdowns over that span. Despite tearing his ACL in 1984, Warner continued to dominate the NFL for several seasons before wrapping up his career in 1990 with the Los Angeles Rams.
Since his playing days, Warner has been busy working in a partnership with Xfinity by Comcast, promoting the new X1 Sports app from Xfinitiy .
Curt will be available to answer your questions on his playing days in Seattle, the upcoming Seahawks season, his partnership with Comcast and more in a live chat at 1:30 p.m. Wednesday on seattletimes.com/sports.
Sean Quinton
